name: interflow
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a continuous movement between two or more things, places, people, etc.: the interflow of ideas and experiences a study of the cultural interflow between Korea and Japan
More examplesFewer examplesThere is an interflow of artist and theme that produces moments of astonishing innovation.The scientific approach was transmitted across institutions by the interflow of personnel through the scientific network.The learning process is not thought of as simply an acquiring of knowledge, but as an interflow of persons.
